solution.text:
A carnot cycle considers a reversible engine that operates between only two temperatures.

The process used must be a reversible adiabatic process which involves no heat flow from any reservoir. If another process is employed instead (say an isochoric process) to take the system from one temperature to another, we would need a series of reservoirs in the temperature range \(T_1\) to \(T_2\) to ensure that at each stage the process is quasi-static but this violates our previous goal of operating only between two temperatures. Since the pressure and volume are increasing, it must be adiabatic compression
